channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AL

item.title: Report E-2024030609
item.description:
Report E-2024030609

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-01T03:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-02
  • City: BIRMINGHAM
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG LEASING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 615000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC unit was traveling on I 59 near Birmingham, AL. The driver lost control of the unit and went off the roadway and rolled over. The trailer was compromised and approximately 6000 gallons of gasoline was released. Hepaco Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report E-2024030596
item.description:
Report E-2024030596

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-01T03:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-29
  • City: BESSEMER
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported a spill was discovered inside of a trailer in Bessemer, AL. The spill consisted of approximately 10 gallons of BYK-A 500 (UN1993), which released from the bottom of a 55 gallon metal drum due to mishandling by the previous terminal. Most of the liquid was dried up by the time it arrived. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal, who stated they would wipe up the remaining liquid with Oil Dri and they would overpack the drum in a 65 gallon poly drum and leave it in the waste area at the terminal to be managed.

item.title: Report X-2024031362
item.description:
Report X-2024031362

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-25
  • City: BESSEMER
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While transporting package to van line for loading, granules from inside began leaking out. Package was place in a bin to contain spillage. DescribePack: The bottom of the internal drum cracked and split, allowing contents to spill into external box. Box contained the majority of the spillage, but some still came through open flaps of box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Loose granules were swept up and place in bin with package.

item.title: Report X-2024031314
item.description:
Report X-2024031314

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-11
  • City: MADISON
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: There was a loose cap that caused an internal leakage. DescribePack: Loose cap on internal package causing spill. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Leaking box was put in hazmat bag then put in black tote, then removed from scene.
